2385  /**
2386  * Fires before a post is deleted, at the start of wp_delete_post().
2387  *
2388  * @since 3.2.0
2389  *
2390  * @see wp_delete_post()
2391  *
2392  * @param int $postid Post ID.
2393  */
2394  do_action( 'before_delete_post', $postid );
2395 
2396  delete_post_meta($postid,'_wp_trash_meta_status');
2397  delete_post_meta($postid,'_wp_trash_meta_time');
2398 
2399  wp_delete_object_term_relationships($postid, get_object_taxonomies($post->post_type));
2400 
2401  $parent_data = array( 'post_parent' => $post->post_parent );
2402  $parent_where = array( 'post_parent' => $postid );
2403 
2404  if ( is_post_type_hierarchical( $post->post_type ) ) {
2405  // Point children of this page to its parent, also clean the cache of affected children.
2406  $children_query = $wpdb->prepare( "SELECT * FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_parent = %d AND post_type = %s", $postid, $post->post_type );
2407  $children = $wpdb->get_results( $children_query );
2408  if ( $children ) {
2409  $wpdb->update( $wpdb->posts, $parent_data, $parent_where + array( 'post_type' => $post->post_type ) );
2410  }
2411  }
2412 
2413  // Do raw query. wp_get_post_revisions() is filtered.
2414  $revision_ids = $wpdb->get_col( $wpdb->prepare( "SELECT ID FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_parent = %d AND post_type = 'revision'", $postid ) );
2415  // Use wp_delete_post (via wp_delete_post_revision) again. Ensures any meta/misplaced data gets cleaned up.
2416  foreach ( $revision_ids as $revision_id )
2417  wp_delete_post_revision( $revision_id );
2418 
2419  // Point all attachments to this post up one level.
2420  $wpdb->update( $wpdb->posts, $parent_data, $parent_where + array( 'post_type' => 'attachment' ) );
2421 
2422  wp_defer_comment_counting( true );
2423 
2424  $comment_ids = $wpdb->get_col( $wpdb->prepare( "SELECT comment_ID FROM $wpdb->comments WHERE comment_post_ID = %d", $postid ));
2425  foreach ( $comment_ids as $comment_id ) {
2426  wp_delete_comment( $comment_id, true );
2427  }
2428 
2429  wp_defer_comment_counting( false );
2430 
2431  $post_meta_ids = $wpdb->get_col( $wpdb->prepare( "SELECT meta_id FROM $wpdb->postmeta WHERE post_id = %d ", $postid ));
2432  foreach ( $post_meta_ids as $mid )
2433  delete_metadata_by_mid( 'post', $mid );
2434 
2435  /**
2436  * Fires immediately before a post is deleted from the database.
2437  *
2438  * @since 1.2.0
2439  *
2440  * @param int $postid Post ID.
2441  */
2442  do_action( 'delete_post', $postid );
2443  $result = $wpdb->delete( $wpdb->posts, array( 'ID' => $postid ) );
2444  if ( ! $result ) {
2445  return false;
2446  }

2454  */
2455  do_action( 'deleted_post', $postid );

2458 
2459  if ( is_post_type_hierarchical( $post->post_type ) && $children ) {
2460  foreach ( $children as $child )
2461  clean_post_cache( $child );
2462  }
2463 
2464  wp_clear_scheduled_hook('publish_future_post', array( $postid ) );

2527  return $post;
2528 
2529  if ( $post['post_status'] == 'trash' )
2530  return false;

2545  wp_insert_post( wp_slash( $post ) );

2608 /**
2609  * Moves comments for a post to the trash.
2610  *
2611  * @since 2.9.0
2612  *
2613  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
2614  *
2615  * @param int|WP_Post|null $post Optional. Post ID or post object. Defaults to global $post.
2616  * @return mixed|void False on failure.
2617  */
2618 function wp_trash_post_comments( $post = null ) {
2619  global $wpdb;
2620 
2621  $post = get_post($post);
2622  if ( empty($post) )
2623  return;
2624 
2625  $post_id = $post->ID;
2626 
2627  /**
2628  * Fires before comments are sent to the trash.
2629  *
2630  * @since 2.9.0
2631  *
2632  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
2633  */
2634  do_action( 'trash_post_comments', $post_id );
2635 
2636  $comments = $wpdb->get_results( $wpdb->prepare("SELECT comment_ID, comment_approved FROM $wpdb->comments WHERE comment_post_ID = %d", $post_id) );
2637  if ( empty($comments) )
2638  return;
2639 
2640  // Cache current status for each comment.
2641  $statuses = array();
2642  foreach ( $comments as $comment )
2643  $statuses[$comment->comment_ID] = $comment->comment_approved;
2644  add_post_meta($post_id, '_wp_trash_meta_comments_status', $statuses);
2645 
2646  // Set status for all comments to post-trashed.
2647  $result = $wpdb->update($wpdb->comments, array('comment_approved' => 'post-trashed'), array('comment_post_ID' => $post_id));
2648 
2649  clean_comment_cache( array_keys($statuses) );
2650

2652  * Fires after comments are sent to the trash.
2653  *
2654  * @since 2.9.0
2655  *
2656  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
2657  * @param array $statuses Array of comment statuses.
2658  */
2659  do_action( 'trashed_post_comments', $post_id, $statuses );
2660 
2661  return $result;
2662 }

2664 /**
2665  * Restore comments for a post from the trash.
2666  *
2667  * @since 2.9.0
2668  *
2669  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
2670  *
2671  * @param int|WP_Post|null $post Optional. Post ID or post object. Defaults to global $post.
2672  * @return true|void
2673  */
2674 function wp_untrash_post_comments( $post = null ) {
2675  global $wpdb;
2676 
2677  $post = get_post($post);
2678  if ( empty($post) )
2679  return;
2680 
2681  $post_id = $post->ID;
2682 
2683  $statuses = get_post_meta($post_id, '_wp_trash_meta_comments_status', true);
2684 
2685  if ( empty($statuses) )
2686  return true;
2687 
2688  /**
2689  * Fires before comments are restored for a post from the trash.
2690  *
2691  * @since 2.9.0
2692  *
2693  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
2694  */
2695  do_action( 'untrash_post_comments', $post_id );
2696 
2697  // Restore each comment to its original status.
2698  $group_by_status = array();
2699  foreach ( $statuses as $comment_id => $comment_status )
2700  $group_by_status[$comment_status][] = $comment_id;
2701 
2702  foreach ( $group_by_status as $status => $comments ) {
2703  // Sanity check. This shouldn't happen.
2704  if ( 'post-trashed' == $status ) {
2705  $status = '0';
2706  }
2707  $comments_in = implode( ', ', array_map( 'intval', $comments ) );
2708  $wpdb->query( $wpdb->prepare( "UPDATE $wpdb->comments SET comment_approved = %s WHERE comment_ID IN ($comments_in)", $status ) );
2709  }
2710 
2711  clean_comment_cache( array_keys($statuses) );
2712 
2713  delete_post_meta($post_id, '_wp_trash_meta_comments_status');
2714

2716  * Fires after comments are restored for a post from the trash.
2717  *
2718  * @since 2.9.0
2719  *
2720  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
2721  */
2722  do_action( 'untrashed_post_comments', $post_id );
2723 }

2795 /**
2796  * Retrieve a number of recent posts.
2797  *
2798  * @since 1.0.0
2799  *
2800  * @see get_posts()
2801  *
2802  * @param array $args Optional. Arguments to retrieve posts. Default empty array.
2803  * @param string $output Optional. Type of output. Accepts ARRAY_A or ''. Default ARRAY_A.
2804  * @return array|false Associative array if $output equals ARRAY_A, array or false if no results.
2805  */
2806 function wp_get_recent_posts( $args = array(), $output = ARRAY_A ) {
2807 
2808  if ( is_numeric( $args ) ) {
2809  _deprecated_argument( __FUNCTION__, '3.1', __( 'Passing an integer number of posts is deprecated. Pass an array of arguments instead.' ) );
2810  $args = array( 'numberposts' => absint( $args ) );
2811  }
2812 
2813  // Set default arguments.
2814  $defaults = array(
2815  'numberposts' => 10, 'offset' => 0,
2816  'category' => 0, 'orderby' => 'post_date',
2817  'order' => 'DESC', 'include' => '',
2818  'exclude' => '', 'meta_key' => '',
2819  'meta_value' =>'', 'post_type' => 'post', 'post_status' => 'draft, publish, future, pending, private',
2820  'suppress_filters' => true
2821  );
2822

2824

2826

2828  if ( ARRAY_A == $output ){
2829  foreach ( $results as $key => $result ) {
2830  $results[$key] = get_object_vars( $result );
2831  }
2832  return $results ? $results : array();
2833  }
2834

2839 /**
2840  * Insert or update a post.
2841  *
2842  * If the $postarr parameter has 'ID' set to a value, then post will be updated.
2843  *
2844  * You can set the post date manually, by setting the values for 'post_date'
2845  * and 'post_date_gmt' keys. You can close the comments or open the comments by
2846  * setting the value for 'comment_status' key.
2847  *
2848  * @since 1.0.0
2849  * @since 4.2.0 Support was added for encoding emoji in the post title, content, and excerpt.
2850  * @since 4.4.0 A 'meta_input' array can now be passed to `$postarr` to add post meta data.
2851  *
2852  * @see sanitize_post()
2853  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
2854  *
2855  * @param array $postarr {
2856  * An array of elements that make up a post to update or insert.
2857  *
2858  * @type int $ID The post ID. If equal to something other than 0,
2859  * the post with that ID will be updated. Default 0.
2860  * @type int $post_author The ID of the user who added the post. Default is
2861  * the current user ID.
2862  * @type string $post_date The date of the post. Default is the current time.
2863  * @type string $post_date_gmt The date of the post in the GMT timezone. Default is
2864  * the value of `$post_date`.
2865  * @type mixed $post_content The post content. Default empty.
2866  * @type string $post_content_filtered The filtered post content. Default empty.
2867  * @type string $post_title The post title. Default empty.
2868  * @type string $post_excerpt The post excerpt. Default empty.
2869  * @type string $post_status The post status. Default 'draft'.
2870  * @type string $post_type The post type. Default 'post'.
2871  * @type string $comment_status Whether the post can accept comments. Accepts 'open' or 'closed'.
2872  * Default is the value of 'default_comment_status' option.
2873  * @type string $ping_status Whether the post can accept pings. Accepts 'open' or 'closed'.
2874  * Default is the value of 'default_ping_status' option.
2875  * @type string $post_password The password to access the post. Default empty.
2876  * @type string $post_name The post name. Default is the sanitized post title
2877  * when creating a new post.
2878  * @type string $to_ping Space or carriage return-separated list of URLs to ping.
2879  * Default empty.
2880  * @type string $pinged Space or carriage return-separated list of URLs that have
2881  * been pinged. Default empty.
2882  * @type string $post_modified The date when the post was last modified. Default is
2883  * the current time.
2884  * @type string $post_modified_gmt The date when the post was last modified in the GMT
2885  * timezone. Default is the current time.
2886  * @type int $post_parent Set this for the post it belongs to, if any. Default 0.
2887  * @type int $menu_order The order the post should be displayed in. Default 0.
2888  * @type string $post_mime_type The mime type of the post. Default empty.
2889  * @type string $guid Global Unique ID for referencing the post. Default empty.
2890  * @type array $tax_input Array of taxonomy terms keyed by their taxonomy name. Default empty.
2891  * @type array $meta_input Array of post meta values keyed by their post meta key. Default empty.
2892  * }
2893  * @param bool $wp_error Optional. Whether to allow return of WP_Error on failure. Default false.
2894  * @return int|WP_Error The post ID on success. The value 0 or WP_Error on failure.
2895  */
2896 function wp_insert_post( $postarr, $wp_error = false ) {
2897  global $wpdb;
2898

2900

2903  'post_content' => '',
2904  'post_content_filtered' => '',
2905  'post_title' => '',
2906  'post_excerpt' => '',
2907  'post_status' => 'draft',
2908  'post_type' => 'post',
2909  'comment_status' => '',
2910  'ping_status' => '',

2927  // Are we updating or creating?

2936  $post_ID = $postarr['ID'];

2938  if ( is_null( $post_before ) ) {
2939  if ( $wp_error ) {

2945  $guid = get_post_field( 'guid', $post_ID );
2946  $previous_status = get_post_field('post_status', $post_ID );
2947  } else {

2949  }

2956  if ( isset( $postarr['post_name'] ) ) {
2957  $post_name = $postarr['post_name'];
2958  } elseif ( $update ) {

2960  $post_name = $post_before->post_name;
2961  }
2962 
2963  $maybe_empty = 'attachment' !== $post_type
2964  && ! $post_content && ! $post_title && ! $post_excerpt
2965  && post_type_supports( $post_type, 'editor' )
2966  && post_type_supports( $post_type, 'title' )
2967  && post_type_supports( $post_type, 'excerpt' );

2970  * Filter whether the post should be considered "empty".
2971  *
2972  * The post is considered "empty" if both:
2973  * 1. The post type supports the title, editor, and excerpt fields
2974  * 2. The title, editor, and excerpt fields are all empty
2975  *
2976  * Returning a truthy value to the filter will effectively short-circuit
2977  * the new post being inserted, returning 0. If $wp_error is true, a WP_Error
2978  * will be returned instead.
2979  *
2980  * @since 3.3.0
2981  *

2983  * @param array $postarr Array of post data.
2984  */
2985  if ( apply_filters( 'wp_insert_post_empty_content', $maybe_empty, $postarr ) ) {
2986  if ( $wp_error ) {
2987  return new WP_Error( 'empty_content', __( 'Content, title, and excerpt are empty.' ) );
2988  } else {
2989  return 0;
2990  }
2991  }
2992 
2993  $post_status = empty( $postarr['post_status'] ) ? 'draft' : $postarr['post_status'];
2994  if ( 'attachment' === $post_type && ! in_array( $post_status, array( 'inherit', 'private', 'trash' ) ) ) {
2995  $post_status = 'inherit';
2996  }
2997 
2998  if ( ! empty( $postarr['post_category'] ) ) {
2999  // Filter out empty terms.
3000  $post_category = array_filter( $postarr['post_category'] );
3001  }

3003  // Make sure we set a valid category.
3004  if ( empty( $post_category ) || 0 == count( $post_category ) || ! is_array( $post_category ) ) {

3006  if ( 'post' == $post_type && 'auto-draft' != $post_status ) {
3007  $post_category = array( get_option('default_category') );
3008  } else {
3009  $post_category = array();

3014  if ( 'pending' == $post_status && !current_user_can( 'publish_posts' ) ) {
3015  $post_name = '';
3016  }
3017 
3018  /*
3019  * Create a valid post name. Drafts and pending posts are allowed to have
3020  * an empty post name.
3021  */
3022  if ( empty($post_name) ) {
3023  if ( !in_array( $post_status, array( 'draft', 'pending', 'auto-draft' ) ) ) {
3024  $post_name = sanitize_title($post_title);
3025  } else {
3026  $post_name = '';
3027  }
3028  } else {
3029  // On updates, we need to check to see if it's using the old, fixed sanitization context.
3030  $check_name = sanitize_title( $post_name, '', 'old-save' );
3031  if ( $update && strtolower( urlencode( $post_name ) ) == $check_name && get_post_field( 'post_name', $post_ID ) == $check_name ) {
3032  $post_name = $check_name;

3035  }

3038  /*
3039  * If the post date is empty (due to having been new or a draft) and status
3040  * is not 'draft' or 'pending', set date to now.
3041  */
3042  if ( empty( $postarr['post_date'] ) || '0000-00-00 00:00:00' == $postarr['post_date'] ) {
3043  if ( empty( $postarr['post_date_gmt'] ) || '0000-00-00 00:00:00' == $postarr['post_date_gmt'] ) {
3044  $post_date = current_time( 'mysql' );
3045  } else {
3046  $post_date = get_date_from_gmt( $postarr['post_date_gmt'] );
3047  }
3048  } else {
3049  $post_date = $postarr['post_date'];
3050  }

3053  $mm = substr( $post_date, 5, 2 );
3054  $jj = substr( $post_date, 8, 2 );

3056  $valid_date = wp_checkdate( $mm, $jj, $aa, $post_date );
3057  if ( ! $valid_date ) {
3058  if ( $wp_error ) {
3059  return new WP_Error( 'invalid_date', __( 'Whoops, the provided date is invalid.' ) );
3060  } else {
3061  return 0;
3062  }
3063  }

3067  $post_date_gmt = get_gmt_from_date( $post_date );
3068  } else {
3069  $post_date_gmt = '0000-00-00 00:00:00';
3070  }
3071  } else {
3072  $post_date_gmt = $postarr['post_date_gmt'];
3073  }

3076  $post_modified = current_time( 'mysql' );
3077  $post_modified_gmt = current_time( 'mysql', 1 );
3078  } else {
3079  $post_modified = $post_date;
3080  $post_modified_gmt = $post_date_gmt;
3081  }

3084  if ( 'publish' == $post_status ) {

3086  if ( mysql2date('U', $post_date_gmt, false) > mysql2date('U', $now, false) ) {
3087  $post_status = 'future';
3088  }
3089  } elseif ( 'future' == $post_status ) {
3090  $now = gmdate('Y-m-d H:i:59');
3091  if ( mysql2date('U', $post_date_gmt, false) <= mysql2date('U', $now, false) ) {
3092  $post_status = 'publish';

3406 /**
3407  * Update a post with new post data.
3408  *
3409  * The date does not have to be set for drafts. You can set the date and it will
3410  * not be overridden.
3411  *
3412  * @since 1.0.0
3413  *
3414  * @param array|object $postarr Optional. Post data. Arrays are expected to be escaped,
3415  * objects are not. Default array.
3416  * @param bool $wp_error Optional. Allow return of WP_Error on failure. Default false.
3417  * @return int|WP_Error The value 0 or WP_Error on failure. The post ID on success.
3418  */
3419 function wp_update_post( $postarr = array(), $wp_error = false ) {
3420  if ( is_object($postarr) ) {
3421  // Non-escaped post was passed.
3422  $postarr = get_object_vars($postarr);
3423  $postarr = wp_slash($postarr);
3424  }
3425 
3426  // First, get all of the original fields.
3427  $post = get_post($postarr['ID'], ARRAY_A);
3428 
3429  if ( is_null( $post ) ) {
3430  if ( $wp_error )
3431  return new WP_Error( 'invalid_post', __( 'Invalid post ID.' ) );
3432  return 0;
3433  }
3434 
3435  // Escape data pulled from DB.
3436  $post = wp_slash($post);
3437 
3438  // Passed post category list overwrites existing category list if not empty.
3439  if ( isset($postarr['post_category']) && is_array($postarr['post_category'])
3440  && 0 != count($postarr['post_category']) )
3441  $post_cats = $postarr['post_category'];
3442  else
3443  $post_cats = $post['post_category'];
3444 
3445  // Drafts shouldn't be assigned a date unless explicitly done so by the user.
3446  if ( isset( $post['post_status'] ) && in_array($post['post_status'], array('draft', 'pending', 'auto-draft')) && empty($postarr['edit_date']) &&
3447  ('0000-00-00 00:00:00' == $post['post_date_gmt']) )
3448  $clear_date = true;
3449  else
3450  $clear_date = false;
3451 
3452  // Merge old and new fields with new fields overwriting old ones.
3453  $postarr = array_merge($post, $postarr);
3454  $postarr['post_category'] = $post_cats;
3455  if ( $clear_date ) {
3456  $postarr['post_date'] = current_time('mysql');
3457  $postarr['post_date_gmt'] = '';
3458  }
3459 
3460  if ($postarr['post_type'] == 'attachment')
3461  return wp_insert_attachment($postarr);
3462 
3463  return wp_insert_post( $postarr, $wp_error );
3464 }

3466 /**
3467  * Publish a post by transitioning the post status.
3468  *
3469  * @since 2.1.0
3470  *
3471  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
3472  *
3473  * @param int|WP_Post $post Post ID or post object.
3474  */
3475 function wp_publish_post( $post ) {
3476  global $wpdb;
3477 
3478  if ( ! $post = get_post( $post ) )
3479  return;
3480 
3481  if ( 'publish' == $post->post_status )
3482  return;
3483 
3484  $wpdb->update( $wpdb->posts, array( 'post_status' => 'publish' ), array( 'ID' => $post->ID ) );
3485 
3486  clean_post_cache( $post->ID );
3487 
3488  $old_status = $post->post_status;
3489  $post->post_status = 'publish';
3490  wp_transition_post_status( 'publish', $old_status, $post );
3491 
3492  /** This action is documented in wp-includes/post.php */
3493  do_action( 'edit_post', $post->ID, $post );
3494 
3495  /** This action is documented in wp-includes/post.php */
3496  do_action( "save_post_{$post->post_type}", $post->ID, $post, true );
3497 
3498  /** This action is documented in wp-includes/post.php */
3499  do_action( 'save_post', $post->ID, $post, true );
3500 
3501  /** This action is documented in wp-includes/post.php */
3502  do_action( 'wp_insert_post', $post->ID, $post, true );
3503 }

3505 /**
3506  * Publish future post and make sure post ID has future post status.
3507  *
3508  * Invoked by cron 'publish_future_post' event. This safeguard prevents cron
3509  * from publishing drafts, etc.
3510  *
3511  * @since 2.5.0
3512  *
3513  * @param int|WP_Post $post_id Post ID or post object.
3514  */
3515 function check_and_publish_future_post( $post_id ) {
3516  $post = get_post($post_id);
3517 
3518  if ( empty($post) )
3519  return;
3520 
3521  if ( 'future' != $post->post_status )
3522  return;
3523 
3524  $time = strtotime( $post->post_date_gmt . ' GMT' );
3525 
3526  // Uh oh, someone jumped the gun!
3527  if ( $time > time() ) {
3528  wp_clear_scheduled_hook( 'publish_future_post', array( $post_id ) ); // clear anything else in the system
3529  wp_schedule_single_event( $time, 'publish_future_post', array( $post_id ) );
3530  return;
3531  }
3532 
3533  // wp_publish_post(_ returns no meaningful value.
3534  wp_publish_post( $post_id );
3535 }

3537 /**
3538  * Computes a unique slug for the post, when given the desired slug and some post details.
3539  *
3540  * @since 2.8.0
3541  *
3542  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
3543  * @global WP_Rewrite $wp_rewrite
3544  *
3545  * @param string $slug The desired slug (post_name).
3546  * @param int $post_ID Post ID.
3547  * @param string $post_status No uniqueness checks are made if the post is still draft or pending.
3548  * @param string $post_type Post type.
3549  * @param int $post_parent Post parent ID.
3550  * @return string Unique slug for the post, based on $post_name (with a -1, -2, etc. suffix)
3551  */
3552 function wp_unique_post_slug( $slug, $post_ID, $post_status, $post_type, $post_parent ) {
3553  if ( in_array( $post_status, array( 'draft', 'pending', 'auto-draft' ) ) || ( 'inherit' == $post_status && 'revision' == $post_type ) )
3554  return $slug;
3555 
3556  global $wpdb, $wp_rewrite;
3557 
3558  $original_slug = $slug;
3559 
3560  $feeds = $wp_rewrite->feeds;
3561  if ( ! is_array( $feeds ) )
3562  $feeds = array();
3563 
3564  if ( 'attachment' == $post_type ) {
3565  // Attachment slugs must be unique across all types.
3566  $check_sql = "SELECT post_name FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_name = %s AND ID != %d LIMIT 1";
3567  $post_name_check = $wpdb->get_var( $wpdb->prepare( $check_sql, $slug, $post_ID ) );
3568 
3569  /**
3570  * Filter whether the post slug would make a bad attachment slug.
3571  *
3572  * @since 3.1.0
3573  *
3574  * @param bool $bad_slug Whether the slug would be bad as an attachment slug.
3575  * @param string $slug The post slug.
3576  */
3577  if ( $post_name_check || in_array( $slug, $feeds ) || apply_filters( 'wp_unique_post_slug_is_bad_attachment_slug', false, $slug ) ) {
3578  $suffix = 2;
3579  do {
3580  $alt_post_name = _truncate_post_slug( $slug, 200 - ( strlen( $suffix ) + 1 ) ) . "-$suffix";
3581  $post_name_check = $wpdb->get_var( $wpdb->prepare( $check_sql, $alt_post_name, $post_ID ) );
3582  $suffix++;
3583  } while ( $post_name_check );
3584  $slug = $alt_post_name;
3585  }
3586  } elseif ( is_post_type_hierarchical( $post_type ) ) {
3587  if ( 'nav_menu_item' == $post_type )
3588  return $slug;
3589 
3590  /*
3591  * Page slugs must be unique within their own trees. Pages are in a separate
3592  * namespace than posts so page slugs are allowed to overlap post slugs.
3593  */
3594  $check_sql = "SELECT post_name FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_name = %s AND post_type IN ( %s, 'attachment' ) AND ID != %d AND post_parent = %d LIMIT 1";
3595  $post_name_check = $wpdb->get_var( $wpdb->prepare( $check_sql, $slug, $post_type, $post_ID, $post_parent ) );
3596 
3597  /**
3598  * Filter whether the post slug would make a bad hierarchical post slug.
3599  *
3600  * @since 3.1.0
3601  *
3602  * @param bool $bad_slug Whether the post slug would be bad in a hierarchical post context.
3603  * @param string $slug The post slug.
3604  * @param string $post_type Post type.
3605  * @param int $post_parent Post parent ID.
3606  */
3607  if ( $post_name_check || in_array( $slug, $feeds ) || preg_match( "@^($wp_rewrite->pagination_base)?\d+$@", $slug ) || apply_filters( 'wp_unique_post_slug_is_bad_hierarchical_slug', false, $slug, $post_type, $post_parent ) ) {
3608  $suffix = 2;
3609  do {
3610  $alt_post_name = _truncate_post_slug( $slug, 200 - ( strlen( $suffix ) + 1 ) ) . "-$suffix";
3611  $post_name_check = $wpdb->get_var( $wpdb->prepare( $check_sql, $alt_post_name, $post_type, $post_ID, $post_parent ) );
3612  $suffix++;
3613  } while ( $post_name_check );
3614  $slug = $alt_post_name;
3615  }
3616  } else {
3617  // Post slugs must be unique across all posts.
3618  $check_sql = "SELECT post_name FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_name = %s AND post_type = %s AND ID != %d LIMIT 1";
3619  $post_name_check = $wpdb->get_var( $wpdb->prepare( $check_sql, $slug, $post_type, $post_ID ) );
3620 
3621  // Prevent new post slugs that could result in URLs that conflict with date archives.
3622  $post = get_post( $post_ID );
3623  $conflicts_with_date_archive = false;
3624  if ( 'post' === $post_type && ( ! $post || $post->post_name !== $slug ) && preg_match( '/^[0-9]+$/', $slug ) && $slug_num = intval( $slug ) ) {
3625  $permastructs = array_values( array_filter( explode( '/', get_option( 'permalink_structure' ) ) ) );
3626  $postname_index = array_search( '%postname%', $permastructs );
3627 
3628  /*
3629  * Potential date clashes are as follows:
3630  *
3631  * - Any integer in the first permastruct position could be a year.
3632  * - An integer between 1 and 12 that follows 'year' conflicts with 'monthnum'.
3633  * - An integer between 1 and 31 that follows 'monthnum' conflicts with 'day'.
3634  */
3635  if ( 0 === $postname_index ||
3636  ( $postname_index && '%year%' === $permastructs[ $postname_index - 1 ] && 13 > $slug_num ) ||
3637  ( $postname_index && '%monthnum%' === $permastructs[ $postname_index - 1 ] && 32 > $slug_num )
3638  ) {
3639  $conflicts_with_date_archive = true;
3640  }
3641  }
3642 
3643  /**
3644  * Filter whether the post slug would be bad as a flat slug.
3645  *
3646  * @since 3.1.0
3647  *
3648  * @param bool $bad_slug Whether the post slug would be bad as a flat slug.
3649  * @param string $slug The post slug.
3650  * @param string $post_type Post type.
3651  */
3652  if ( $post_name_check || in_array( $slug, $feeds ) || $conflicts_with_date_archive || apply_filters( 'wp_unique_post_slug_is_bad_flat_slug', false, $slug, $post_type ) ) {
3653  $suffix = 2;
3654  do {
3655  $alt_post_name = _truncate_post_slug( $slug, 200 - ( strlen( $suffix ) + 1 ) ) . "-$suffix";
3656  $post_name_check = $wpdb->get_var( $wpdb->prepare( $check_sql, $alt_post_name, $post_type, $post_ID ) );
3657  $suffix++;
3658  } while ( $post_name_check );
3659  $slug = $alt_post_name;
3660  }
3661  }
3662 
3663  /**
3664  * Filter the unique post slug.
3665  *
3666  * @since 3.3.0
3667  *
3668  * @param string $slug The post slug.
3669  * @param int $post_ID Post ID.
3670  * @param string $post_status The post status.
3671  * @param string $post_type Post type.
3672  * @param int $post_parent Post parent ID
3673  * @param string $original_slug The original post slug.
3674  */
3675  return apply_filters( 'wp_unique_post_slug', $slug, $post_ID, $post_status, $post_type, $post_parent, $original_slug );
3676 }
3677 
3678 /**
3679  * Truncate a post slug.
3680  *
3681  * @since 3.6.0
3682  * @access private
3683  *
3684  * @see utf8_uri_encode()
3685  *
3686  * @param string $slug The slug to truncate.
3687  * @param int $length Optional. Max length of the slug. Default 200 (characters).
3688  * @return string The truncated slug.
3689  */
3690 function _truncate_post_slug( $slug, $length = 200 ) {
3691  if ( strlen( $slug ) > $length ) {
3692  $decoded_slug = urldecode( $slug );
3693  if ( $decoded_slug === $slug )
3694  $slug = substr( $slug, 0, $length );
3695  else
3696  $slug = utf8_uri_encode( $decoded_slug, $length );
3697  }
3698 
3699  return rtrim( $slug, '-' );
3700 }

3710  * @param string|array $tags Optional. An array of tags to set for the post, or a string of tags

3714 function wp_add_post_tags( $post_id = 0, $tags = '' ) {

3719  * Set the tags for a post.
3720  *
3721  * @since 2.3.0
3722  *
3723  * @see wp_set_object_terms()
3724  *
3725  * @param int $post_id Optional. The Post ID. Does not default to the ID of the global $post.
3726  * @param string|array $tags Optional. An array of tags to set for the post, or a string of tags
3727  * separated by commas. Default empty.
3728  * @param bool $append Optional. If true, don't delete existing tags, just add on. If false,
3729  * replace the tags with the new tags. Default false.
3730  * @return array|false|WP_Error Array of affected term IDs. WP_Error or false on failure.
3731  */
3732 function wp_set_post_tags( $post_id = 0, $tags = '', $append = false ) {
3733  return wp_set_post_terms( $post_id, $tags, 'post_tag', $append);

3736 /**
3737  * Set the terms for a post.
3738  *
3739  * @since 2.8.0
3740  *
3741  * @see wp_set_object_terms()
3742  *
3743  * @param int $post_id Optional. The Post ID. Does not default to the ID of the global $post.
3744  * @param string|array $tags Optional. An array of terms to set for the post, or a string of terms
3745  * separated by commas. Default empty.
3746  * @param string $taxonomy Optional. Taxonomy name. Default 'post_tag'.
3747  * @param bool $append Optional. If true, don't delete existing terms, just add on. If false,
3748  * replace the terms with the new terms. Default false.
3749  * @return array|false|WP_Error Array of affected term IDs. WP_Error or false on failure.
3750  */
3751 function wp_set_post_terms( $post_id = 0, $tags = '', $taxonomy = 'post_tag', $append = false ) {
3752  $post_id = (int) $post_id;
3753 
3754  if ( !$post_id )
3755  return false;
3756 
3757  if ( empty($tags) )
3758  $tags = array();
3759 
3760  if ( ! is_array( $tags ) ) {
3761  $comma = _x( ',', 'tag delimiter' );
3762  if ( ',' !== $comma )
3763  $tags = str_replace( $comma, ',', $tags );
3764  $tags = explode( ',', trim( $tags, " \n\t\r\0\x0B," ) );
3765  }
3766 
3767  /*
3768  * Hierarchical taxonomies must always pass IDs rather than names so that
3769  * children with the same names but different parents aren't confused.
3770  */
3771  if ( is_taxonomy_hierarchical( $taxonomy ) ) {
3772  $tags = array_unique( array_map( 'intval', $tags ) );
3773  }
3774 
3775  return wp_set_object_terms( $post_id, $tags, $taxonomy, $append );
3776 }

3778 /**
3779  * Set categories for a post.
3780  *
3781  * If the post categories parameter is not set, then the default category is
3782  * going used.
3783  *
3784  * @since 2.1.0
3785  *
3786  * @param int $post_ID Optional. The Post ID. Does not default to the ID
3787  * of the global $post. Default 0.
3788  * @param array|int $post_categories Optional. List of categories or ID of category.
3789  * Default empty array.
3790  * @param bool $append If true, don't delete existing categories, just add on.
3791  * If false, replace the categories with the new categories.
3792  * @return array|bool|WP_Error
3793  */
3794 function wp_set_post_categories( $post_ID = 0, $post_categories = array(), $append = false ) {
3795  $post_ID = (int) $post_ID;
3796  $post_type = get_post_type( $post_ID );
3797  $post_status = get_post_status( $post_ID );
3798  // If $post_categories isn't already an array, make it one:
3799  $post_categories = (array) $post_categories;
3800  if ( empty( $post_categories ) ) {
3801  if ( 'post' == $post_type && 'auto-draft' != $post_status ) {
3802  $post_categories = array( get_option('default_category') );
3803  $append = false;
3804  } else {
3805  $post_categories = array();
3806  }
3807  } elseif ( 1 == count( $post_categories ) && '' == reset( $post_categories ) ) {
3808  return true;
3809  }
3810 
3811  return wp_set_post_terms( $post_ID, $post_categories, 'category', $append );
3812 }

3814 /**
3815  * Fires actions related to the transitioning of a post's status.
3816  *
3817  * When a post is saved, the post status is "transitioned" from one status to another,
3818  * though this does not always mean the status has actually changed before and after
3819  * the save. This function fires a number of action hooks related to that transition:
3820  * the generic 'transition_post_status' action, as well as the dynamic hooks
3821  * `"{$old_status}_to_{$new_status}"` and `"{$new_status}_{$post->post_type}"`. Note
3822  * that the function does not transition the post object in the database.
3823  *
3824  * For instance: When publishing a post for the first time, the post status may transition
3825  * from 'draft' or some other status to 'publish'. However, if a post is already
3826  * published and is simply being updated, the "old" and "new" statuses may both be 'publish'
3827  * before and after the transition.
3828  *
3829  * @since 2.3.0
3830  *
3831  * @param string $new_status Transition to this post status.
3832  * @param string $old_status Previous post status.
3833  * @param WP_Post $post Post data.
3834  */
3835 function wp_transition_post_status( $new_status, $old_status, $post ) {
3836  /**
3837  * Fires when a post is transitioned from one status to another.
3838  *
3839  * @since 2.3.0
3840  *
3841  * @param string $new_status New post status.
3842  * @param string $old_status Old post status.
3843  * @param WP_Post $post Post object.
3844  */
3845  do_action( 'transition_post_status', $new_status, $old_status, $post );
3846 
3847  /**
3848  * Fires when a post is transitioned from one status to another.
3849  *
3850  * The dynamic portions of the hook name, `$new_status` and `$old status`,
3851  * refer to the old and new post statuses, respectively.
3852  *
3853  * @since 2.3.0
3854  *
3855  * @param WP_Post $post Post object.
3856  */
3857  do_action( "{$old_status}_to_{$new_status}", $post );
3858 
3859  /**
3860  * Fires when a post is transitioned from one status to another.
3861  *
3862  * The dynamic portions of the hook name, `$new_status` and `$post->post_type`,
3863  * refer to the new post status and post type, respectively.
3864  *
3865  * Please note: When this action is hooked using a particular post status (like
3866  * 'publish', as `publish_{$post->post_type}`), it will fire both when a post is
3867  * first transitioned to that status from something else, as well as upon
3868  * subsequent post updates (old and new status are both the same).
3869  *
3870  * Therefore, if you are looking to only fire a callback when a post is first
3871  * transitioned to a status, use the {@see 'transition_post_status'} hook instead.
3872  *
3873  * @since 2.3.0
3874  *
3875  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
3876  * @param WP_Post $post Post object.
3877  */
3878  do_action( "{$new_status}_{$post->post_type}", $post->ID, $post );
3879 }

3882 // Comment, trackback, and pingback functions.
3883 //

3885 /**
3886  * Add a URL to those already pinged.
3887  *
3888  * @since 1.5.0
3889  *
3890  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
3891  *
3892  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
3893  * @param string $uri Ping URI.
3894  * @return int|false How many rows were updated.
3895  */
3896 function add_ping( $post_id, $uri ) {
3897  global $wpdb;
3898  $pung = $wpdb->get_var( $wpdb->prepare( "SELECT pinged FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE ID = %d", $post_id ));
3899  $pung = trim($pung);
3900  $pung = preg_split('/\s/', $pung);
3901  $pung[] = $uri;
3902  $new = implode("\n", $pung);
3903 
3904  /**
3905  * Filter the new ping URL to add for the given post.
3906  *
3907  * @since 2.0.0
3908  *
3909  * @param string $new New ping URL to add.
3910  */
3911  $new = apply_filters( 'add_ping', $new );
3912 
3913  // expected_slashed ($new).
3914  $new = wp_unslash($new);
3915  return $wpdb->update( $wpdb->posts, array( 'pinged' => $new ), array( 'ID' => $post_id ) );
3916 }
3917 
3918 /**
3919  * Retrieve enclosures already enclosed for a post.
3920  *
3921  * @since 1.5.0
3922  *
3923  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
3924  * @return array List of enclosures.
3925  */
3926 function get_enclosed( $post_id ) {
3927  $custom_fields = get_post_custom( $post_id );
3928  $pung = array();
3929  if ( !is_array( $custom_fields ) )
3930  return $pung;
3931 
3932  foreach ( $custom_fields as $key => $val ) {
3933  if ( 'enclosure' != $key || !is_array( $val ) )
3934  continue;
3935  foreach ( $val as $enc ) {
3936  $enclosure = explode( "\n", $enc );
3937  $pung[] = trim( $enclosure[ 0 ] );
3938  }
3939  }
3940 
3941  /**
3942  * Filter the list of enclosures already enclosed for the given post.
3943  *
3944  * @since 2.0.0
3945  *
3946  * @param array $pung Array of enclosures for the given post.
3947  * @param int $post_id Post ID.

4012 function trackback_url_list( $tb_list, $post_id ) {
4013  if ( ! empty( $tb_list ) ) {

4015  $postdata = get_post( $post_id, ARRAY_A );
4016

4018  $excerpt = strip_tags( $postdata['post_excerpt'] ? $postdata['post_excerpt'] : $postdata['post_content'] );
4019 
4020  if ( strlen( $excerpt ) > 255 ) {
4021  $excerpt = substr( $excerpt, 0, 252 ) . '&hellip;';
4022  }
4023 
4024  $trackback_urls = explode( ',', $tb_list );
4025  foreach ( (array) $trackback_urls as $tb_url ) {
4026  $tb_url = trim( $tb_url );
4027  trackback( $tb_url, wp_unslash( $postdata['post_title'] ), $excerpt, $post_id );
4028  }

4076 /**
4077  * Retrieves a page given its path.
4078  *
4079  * @since 2.1.0
4080  *
4081  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
4082  *
4083  * @param string $page_path Page path.
4084  * @param string $output Optional. Output type. Accepts OBJECT, ARRAY_N, or ARRAY_A.
4085  * Default OBJECT.
4086  * @param string|array $post_type Optional. Post type or array of post types. Default 'page'.
4087  * @return WP_Post|array|void WP_Post on success.
4088  */
4089 function get_page_by_path( $page_path, $output = OBJECT, $post_type = 'page' ) {
4090  global $wpdb;
4091 
4092  $page_path = rawurlencode(urldecode($page_path));
4093  $page_path = str_replace('%2F', '/', $page_path);
4094  $page_path = str_replace('%20', ' ', $page_path);
4095  $parts = explode( '/', trim( $page_path, '/' ) );
4096  $parts = esc_sql( $parts );
4097  $parts = array_map( 'sanitize_title_for_query', $parts );
4098 
4099  $in_string = "'" . implode( "','", $parts ) . "'";
4100 
4101  if ( is_array( $post_type ) ) {
4102  $post_types = $post_type;
4103  } else {
4104  $post_types = array( $post_type, 'attachment' );
4105  }
4106 
4107  $post_types = esc_sql( $post_types );
4108  $post_type_in_string = "'" . implode( "','", $post_types ) . "'";
4109  $sql = "
4110  SELECT ID, post_name, post_parent, post_type
4111  FROM $wpdb->posts
4112  WHERE post_name IN ($in_string)
4113  AND post_type IN ($post_type_in_string)
4114  ";
4115 
4116  $pages = $wpdb->get_results( $sql, OBJECT_K );
4117 
4118  $revparts = array_reverse( $parts );
4119 
4120  $foundid = 0;
4121  foreach ( (array) $pages as $page ) {
4122  if ( $page->post_name == $revparts[0] ) {
4123  $count = 0;
4124  $p = $page;
4125 
4126  /*
4127  * Loop through the given path parts from right to left,
4128  * ensuring each matches the post ancestry.
4129  */
4130  while ( $p->post_parent != 0 && isset( $pages[ $p->post_parent ] ) ) {
4131  $count++;
4132  $parent = $pages[ $p->post_parent ];
4133  if ( ! isset( $revparts[ $count ] ) || $parent->post_name != $revparts[ $count ] )
4134  break;
4135  $p = $parent;
4136  }
4137 
4138  if ( $p->post_parent == 0 && $count+1 == count( $revparts ) && $p->post_name == $revparts[ $count ] ) {
4139  $foundid = $page->ID;
4140  if ( $page->post_type == $post_type )
4141  break;
4142  }
4143  }
4144  }
4145 
4146  if ( $foundid ) {
4147  return get_post( $foundid, $output );
4148  }
4149 }
4150 
4151 /**
4152  * Retrieve a page given its title.
4153  *
4154  * @since 2.1.0
4155  *
4156  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
4157  *
4158  * @param string $page_title Page title
4159  * @param string $output Optional. Output type. OBJECT, ARRAY_N, or ARRAY_A.
4160  * Default OBJECT.
4161  * @param string|array $post_type Optional. Post type or array of post types. Default 'page'.
4162  * @return WP_Post|array|void WP_Post on success or null on failure
4163  */
4164 function get_page_by_title( $page_title, $output = OBJECT, $post_type = 'page' ) {
4165  global $wpdb;
4166 
4167  if ( is_array( $post_type ) ) {
4168  $post_type = esc_sql( $post_type );
4169  $post_type_in_string = "'" . implode( "','", $post_type ) . "'";
4170  $sql = $wpdb->prepare( "
4171  SELECT ID
4172  FROM $wpdb->posts
4173  WHERE post_title = %s
4174  AND post_type IN ($post_type_in_string)
4175  ", $page_title );
4176  } else {
4177  $sql = $wpdb->prepare( "
4178  SELECT ID
4179  FROM $wpdb->posts
4180  WHERE post_title = %s
4181  AND post_type = %s
4182  ", $page_title, $post_type );
4183  }
4184 
4185  $page = $wpdb->get_var( $sql );
4186 
4187  if ( $page ) {
4188  return get_post( $page, $output );
4189  }
4190 }

4192 /**
4193  * Identify descendants of a given page ID in a list of page objects.
4194  *
4195  * Descendants are identified from the `$pages` array passed to the function. No database queries are performed.
4196  *
4197  * @since 1.5.1
4198  *
4199  * @param int $page_id Page ID.
4200  * @param array $pages List of page objects from which descendants should be identified.
4201  * @return array List of page children.
4202  */
4203 function get_page_children( $page_id, $pages ) {
4204  // Build a hash of ID -> children.
4205  $children = array();
4206  foreach ( (array) $pages as $page ) {
4207  $children[ intval( $page->post_parent ) ][] = $page;
4208  }
4209 
4210  $page_list = array();
4211 
4212  // Start the search by looking at immediate children.
4213  if ( isset( $children[ $page_id ] ) ) {
4214  // Always start at the end of the stack in order to preserve original `$pages` order.
4215  $to_look = array_reverse( $children[ $page_id ] );
4216 
4217  while ( $to_look ) {
4218  $p = array_pop( $to_look );
4219  $page_list[] = $p;
4220  if ( isset( $children[ $p->ID ] ) ) {
4221  foreach ( array_reverse( $children[ $p->ID ] ) as $child ) {
4222  // Append to the `$to_look` stack to descend the tree.
4223  $to_look[] = $child;
4224  }
4225  }
4226  }
4227  }
4228 
4229  return $page_list;
4230 }
4231 
4232 /**
4233  * Order the pages with children under parents in a flat list.
4234  *
4235  * It uses auxiliary structure to hold parent-children relationships and
4236  * runs in O(N) complexity
4237  *
4238  * @since 2.0.0
4239  *
4240  * @param array $pages Posts array, passed by reference.
4241  * @param int $page_id Optional. Parent page ID. Default 0.
4242  * @return array A list arranged by hierarchy. Children immediately follow their parents.
4243  */
4244 function get_page_hierarchy( &$pages, $page_id = 0 ) {
4245  if ( empty( $pages ) ) {
4246  return array();
4247  }
4248 
4249  $children = array();
4250  foreach ( (array) $pages as $p ) {
4251  $parent_id = intval( $p->post_parent );
4252  $children[ $parent_id ][] = $p;
4253  }
4254 
4255  $result = array();
4256  _page_traverse_name( $page_id, $children, $result );
4257 
4258  return $result;
4259 }
4260 
4261 /**
4262  * Traverse and return all the nested children post names of a root page.
4263  *
4264  * $children contains parent-children relations
4265  *
4266  * @since 2.9.0
4267  *
4268  * @see _page_traverse_name()
4269  *
4270  * @param int $page_id Page ID.
4271  * @param array $children Parent-children relations, passed by reference.
4272  * @param array $result Result, passed by reference.
4273  */
4274 function _page_traverse_name( $page_id, &$children, &$result ){
4275  if ( isset( $children[ $page_id ] ) ){
4276  foreach ( (array)$children[ $page_id ] as $child ) {
4277  $result[ $child->ID ] = $child->post_name;
4278  _page_traverse_name( $child->ID, $children, $result );
4279  }
4280  }
4281 }

4283 /**
4284  * Build the URI path for a page.
4285  *
4286  * Sub pages will be in the "directory" under the parent page post name.
4287  *
4288  * @since 1.5.0
4289  *
4290  * @param WP_Post|object|int $page Page object or page ID.
4291  * @return string|false Page URI, false on error.
4292  */
4293 function get_page_uri( $page ) {
4294  if ( ! $page instanceof WP_Post ) {
4295  $page = get_post( $page );
4296  }
4297 
4298  if ( ! $page )
4299  return false;
4300 
4301  $uri = $page->post_name;
4302 
4303  foreach ( $page->ancestors as $parent ) {
4304  $parent = get_post( $parent );
4305  if ( $parent ) {
4306  $uri = $parent->post_name . '/' . $uri;
4307  }
4308  }
4309 
4310  /**
4311  * Filter the URI for a page.

4315  * @param string $uri Page URI.
4316  * @param WP_Post $page Page object.
4317  */
4318  return apply_filters( 'get_page_uri', $uri, $page );
4319 }
4320 
4321 /**
4322  * Retrieve a list of pages.
4323  *
4324  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
4325  *
4326  * @since 1.5.0
4327  *
4328  * @param array|string $args {
4329  * Optional. Array or string of arguments to retrieve pages.
4330  *
4331  * @type int $child_of Page ID to return child and grandchild pages of. Note: The value
4332  * of `$hierarchical` has no bearing on whether `$child_of` returns
4333  * hierarchical results. Default 0, or no restriction.
4334  * @type string $sort_order How to sort retrieved pages. Accepts 'ASC', 'DESC'. Default 'ASC'.
4335  * @type string $sort_column What columns to sort pages by, comma-separated. Accepts 'post_author',
4336  * 'post_date', 'post_title', 'post_name', 'post_modified', 'menu_order',
4337  * 'post_modified_gmt', 'post_parent', 'ID', 'rand', 'comment_count'.
4338  * 'post_' can be omitted for any values that start with it.
4339  * Default 'post_title'.
4340  * @type bool $hierarchical Whether to return pages hierarchically. If false in conjunction with
4341  * `$child_of` also being false, both arguments will be disregarded.
4342  * Default true.
4343  * @type array $exclude Array of page IDs to exclude. Default empty array.
4344  * @type array $include Array of page IDs to include. Cannot be used with `$child_of`,
4345  * `$parent`, `$exclude`, `$meta_key`, `$meta_value`, or `$hierarchical`.
4346  * Default empty array.
4347  * @type string $meta_key Only include pages with this meta key. Default empty.
4348  * @type string $meta_value Only include pages with this meta value. Requires `$meta_key`.
4349  * Default empty.
4350  * @type string $authors A comma-separated list of author IDs. Default empty.
4351  * @type int $parent Page ID to return direct children of. Default -1, or no restriction.
4352  * @type string|array $exclude_tree Comma-separated string or array of page IDs to exclude.
4353  * Default empty array.
4354  * @type int $number The number of pages to return. Default 0, or all pages.
4355  * @type int $offset The number of pages to skip before returning. Requires `$number`.
4356  * Default 0.
4357  * @type string $post_type The post type to query. Default 'page'.
4358  * @type string $post_status A comma-separated list of post status types to include.
4359  * Default 'publish'.
4360  * }
4361  * @return array|false List of pages matching defaults or `$args`.
4362  */
4363 function get_pages( $args = array() ) {
4364  global $wpdb;
4365 
4366  $defaults = array(
4367  'child_of' => 0, 'sort_order' => 'ASC',
4368  'sort_column' => 'post_title', 'hierarchical' => 1,
4369  'exclude' => array(), 'include' => array(),
4370  'meta_key' => '', 'meta_value' => '',
4371  'authors' => '', 'parent' => -1, 'exclude_tree' => array(),
4372  'number' => '', 'offset' => 0,
4373  'post_type' => 'page', 'post_status' => 'publish',
4374  );
4375 
4376  $r = wp_parse_args( $args, $defaults );
4377 
4378  $number = (int) $r['number'];
4379  $offset = (int) $r['offset'];
4380  $child_of = (int) $r['child_of'];
4381  $hierarchical = $r['hierarchical'];
4382  $exclude = $r['exclude'];
4383  $meta_key = $r['meta_key'];
4384  $meta_value = $r['meta_value'];
4385  $parent = $r['parent'];
4386  $post_status = $r['post_status'];
4387 
4388  // Make sure the post type is hierarchical.
4389  $hierarchical_post_types = get_post_types( array( 'hierarchical' => true ) );
4390  if ( ! in_array( $r['post_type'], $hierarchical_post_types ) ) {
4391  return false;
4392  }
4393 
4394  if ( $parent > 0 && ! $child_of ) {
4395  $hierarchical = false;
4396  }
4397 
4398  // Make sure we have a valid post status.
4399  if ( ! is_array( $post_status ) ) {
4400  $post_status = explode( ',', $post_status );
4401  }
4402  if ( array_diff( $post_status, get_post_stati() ) ) {
4403  return false;
4404  }
4405 
4406  // $args can be whatever, only use the args defined in defaults to compute the key.
4407  $key = md5( serialize( wp_array_slice_assoc( $r, array_keys( $defaults ) ) ) );
4408  $last_changed = wp_cache_get( 'last_changed', 'posts' );
4409  if ( ! $last_changed ) {
4410  $last_changed = microtime();
4411  wp_cache_set( 'last_changed', $last_changed, 'posts' );
4412  }
4413 
4414  $cache_key = "get_pages:$key:$last_changed";
4415  if ( $cache = wp_cache_get( $cache_key, 'posts' ) ) {
4416  // Convert to WP_Post instances.
4417  $pages = array_map( 'get_post', $cache );
4418  /** This filter is documented in wp-includes/post.php */
4419  $pages = apply_filters( 'get_pages', $pages, $r );
4420  return $pages;
4421  }
4422 
4423  $inclusions = '';
4424  if ( ! empty( $r['include'] ) ) {
4425  $child_of = 0; //ignore child_of, parent, exclude, meta_key, and meta_value params if using include
4426  $parent = -1;
4427  $exclude = '';
4428  $meta_key = '';
4429  $meta_value = '';
4430  $hierarchical = false;
4431  $incpages = wp_parse_id_list( $r['include'] );
4432  if ( ! empty( $incpages ) ) {
4433  $inclusions = ' AND ID IN (' . implode( ',', $incpages ) . ')';
4434  }
4435  }
4436 
4437  $exclusions = '';
4438  if ( ! empty( $exclude ) ) {
4439  $expages = wp_parse_id_list( $exclude );
4440  if ( ! empty( $expages ) ) {
4441  $exclusions = ' AND ID NOT IN (' . implode( ',', $expages ) . ')';
4442  }
4443  }
4444 
4445  $author_query = '';
4446  if ( ! empty( $r['authors'] ) ) {
4447  $post_authors = preg_split( '/[\s,]+/', $r['authors'] );
4448 
4449  if ( ! empty( $post_authors ) ) {
4450  foreach ( $post_authors as $post_author ) {
4451  //Do we have an author id or an author login?
4452  if ( 0 == intval($post_author) ) {
4453  $post_author = get_user_by('login', $post_author);
4454  if ( empty( $post_author ) ) {
4455  continue;
4456  }
4457  if ( empty( $post_author->ID ) ) {
4458  continue;
4459  }
4460  $post_author = $post_author->ID;
4461  }
4462 
4463  if ( '' == $author_query ) {
4464  $author_query = $wpdb->prepare(' post_author = %d ', $post_author);
4465  } else {
4466  $author_query .= $wpdb->prepare(' OR post_author = %d ', $post_author);
4467  }
4468  }
4469  if ( '' != $author_query ) {
4470  $author_query = " AND ($author_query)";
4471  }
4472  }
4473  }
4474 
4475  $join = '';
4476  $where = "$exclusions $inclusions ";
4477  if ( '' !== $meta_key || '' !== $meta_value ) {
4478  $join = " LEFT JOIN $wpdb->postmeta ON ( $wpdb->posts.ID = $wpdb->postmeta.post_id )";
4479 
4480  // meta_key and meta_value might be slashed
4481  $meta_key = wp_unslash($meta_key);
4482  $meta_value = wp_unslash($meta_value);
4483  if ( '' !== $meta_key ) {
4484  $where .= $wpdb->prepare(" AND $wpdb->postmeta.meta_key = %s", $meta_key);
4485  }
4486  if ( '' !== $meta_value ) {
4487  $where .= $wpdb->prepare(" AND $wpdb->postmeta.meta_value = %s", $meta_value);
4488  }
4489 
4490  }
4491 
4492  if ( is_array( $parent ) ) {
4493  $post_parent__in = implode( ',', array_map( 'absint', (array) $parent ) );
4494  if ( ! empty( $post_parent__in ) ) {
4495  $where .= " AND post_parent IN ($post_parent__in)";
4496  }
4497  } elseif ( $parent >= 0 ) {
4498  $where .= $wpdb->prepare(' AND post_parent = %d ', $parent);
4499  }
4500 
4501  if ( 1 == count( $post_status ) ) {
4502  $where_post_type = $wpdb->prepare( "post_type = %s AND post_status = %s", $r['post_type'], reset( $post_status ) );
4503  } else {
4504  $post_status = implode( "', '", $post_status );
4505  $where_post_type = $wpdb->prepare( "post_type = %s AND post_status IN ('$post_status')", $r['post_type'] );
4506  }
4507 
4508  $orderby_array = array();
4509  $allowed_keys = array( 'author', 'post_author', 'date', 'post_date', 'title', 'post_title', 'name', 'post_name', 'modified',
4510  'post_modified', 'modified_gmt', 'post_modified_gmt', 'menu_order', 'parent', 'post_parent',
4511  'ID', 'rand', 'comment_count' );
4512 
4513  foreach ( explode( ',', $r['sort_column'] ) as $orderby ) {
4514  $orderby = trim( $orderby );
4515  if ( ! in_array( $orderby, $allowed_keys ) ) {
4516  continue;
4517  }
4518 
4519  switch ( $orderby ) {
4520  case 'menu_order':
4521  break;
4522  case 'ID':
4523  $orderby = "$wpdb->posts.ID";
4524  break;
4525  case 'rand':
4526  $orderby = 'RAND()';
4527  break;
4528  case 'comment_count':
4529  $orderby = "$wpdb->posts.comment_count";
4530  break;
4531  default:
4532  if ( 0 === strpos( $orderby, 'post_' ) ) {
4533  $orderby = "$wpdb->posts." . $orderby;
4534  } else {
4535  $orderby = "$wpdb->posts.post_" . $orderby;
4536  }
4537  }
4538 
4539  $orderby_array[] = $orderby;
4540 
4541  }
4542  $sort_column = ! empty( $orderby_array ) ? implode( ',', $orderby_array ) : "$wpdb->posts.post_title";
4543 
4544  $sort_order = strtoupper( $r['sort_order'] );
4545  if ( '' !== $sort_order && ! in_array( $sort_order, array( 'ASC', 'DESC' ) ) ) {
4546  $sort_order = 'ASC';
4547  }
4548 
4549  $query = "SELECT * FROM $wpdb->posts $join WHERE ($where_post_type) $where ";
4550  $query .= $author_query;
4551  $query .= " ORDER BY " . $sort_column . " " . $sort_order ;
4552 
4553  if ( ! empty( $number ) ) {
4554  $query .= ' LIMIT ' . $offset . ',' . $number;
4555  }
4556 
4557  $pages = $wpdb->get_results($query);
4558 
4559  if ( empty($pages) ) {
4560  /** This filter is documented in wp-includes/post.php */
4561  $pages = apply_filters( 'get_pages', array(), $r );
4562  return $pages;
4563  }
4564 
4565  // Sanitize before caching so it'll only get done once.
4566  $num_pages = count($pages);
4567  for ($i = 0; $i < $num_pages; $i++) {
4568  $pages[$i] = sanitize_post($pages[$i], 'raw');
4569  }
4570 
4571  // Update cache.
4572  update_post_cache( $pages );
4573 
4574  if ( $child_of || $hierarchical ) {
4575  $pages = get_page_children($child_of, $pages);
4576  }
4577 
4578  if ( ! empty( $r['exclude_tree'] ) ) {
4579  $exclude = wp_parse_id_list( $r['exclude_tree'] );
4580  foreach ( $exclude as $id ) {
4581  $children = get_page_children( $id, $pages );
4582  foreach ( $children as $child ) {
4583  $exclude[] = $child->ID;
4584  }
4585  }
4586 
4587  $num_pages = count( $pages );
4588  for ( $i = 0; $i < $num_pages; $i++ ) {
4589  if ( in_array( $pages[$i]->ID, $exclude ) ) {
4590  unset( $pages[$i] );
4591  }
4592  }
4593  }
4594 
4595  $page_structure = array();
4596  foreach ( $pages as $page ) {
4597  $page_structure[] = $page->ID;
4598  }
4599 
4600  wp_cache_set( $cache_key, $page_structure, 'posts' );
4601 
4602  // Convert to WP_Post instances
4603  $pages = array_map( 'get_post', $pages );
4604 
4605  /**
4606  * Filter the retrieved list of pages.
4607  *
4608  * @since 2.1.0
4609  *
4610  * @param array $pages List of pages to retrieve.
4611  * @param array $r Array of get_pages() arguments.
4612  */
4613  return apply_filters( 'get_pages', $pages, $r );
4614 }

4620 /**
4621  * Check if the attachment URI is local one and is really an attachment.
4622  *
4623  * @since 2.0.0
4624  *
4625  * @param string $url URL to check
4626  * @return bool True on success, false on failure.
4627  */
4628 function is_local_attachment($url) {
4629  if (strpos($url, home_url()) === false)
4630  return false;
4631  if (strpos($url, home_url('/?attachment_id=')) !== false)
4632  return true;
4633  if ( $id = url_to_postid($url) ) {
4634  $post = get_post($id);
4635  if ( 'attachment' == $post->post_type )
4636  return true;
4637  }
4638  return false;
4639 }

4641 /**

4643  *
4644  * If you set the 'ID' in the $args parameter, it will mean that you are
4645  * updating and attempt to update the attachment. You can also set the
4646  * attachment name or title by setting the key 'post_name' or 'post_title'.
4647  *
4648  * You can set the dates for the attachment manually by setting the 'post_date'
4649  * and 'post_date_gmt' keys' values.
4650  *

4652  * comments are allowed. You can close them manually or keep them open by

4681 /**
4682  * Trash or delete an attachment.
4683  *
4684  * When an attachment is permanently deleted, the file will also be removed.
4685  * Deletion removes all post meta fields, taxonomy, comments, etc. associated
4686  * with the attachment (except the main post).
4687  *
4688  * The attachment is moved to the trash instead of permanently deleted unless trash
4689  * for media is disabled, item is already in the trash, or $force_delete is true.
4690  *
4691  * @since 2.0.0
4692  *
4693  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
4694  *
4695  * @param int $post_id Attachment ID.
4696  * @param bool $force_delete Optional. Whether to bypass trash and force deletion.
4697  * Default false.
4698  * @return mixed False on failure. Post data on success.
4699  */
4700 function wp_delete_attachment( $post_id, $force_delete = false ) {
4701  global $wpdb;
4702 
4703  if ( !$post = $wpdb->get_row( $wpdb->prepare("SELECT * FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE ID = %d", $post_id) ) )
4704  return $post;
4705 
4706  if ( 'attachment' != $post->post_type )
4707  return false;
4708 
4709  if ( !$force_delete && EMPTY_TRASH_DAYS && MEDIA_TRASH && 'trash' != $post->post_status )
4710  return wp_trash_post( $post_id );
4711 
4712  delete_post_meta($post_id, '_wp_trash_meta_status');
4713  delete_post_meta($post_id, '_wp_trash_meta_time');
4714 
4715  $meta = wp_get_attachment_metadata( $post_id );
4716  $backup_sizes = get_post_meta( $post->ID, '_wp_attachment_backup_sizes', true );
4717  $file = get_attached_file( $post_id );
4718 
4719  if ( is_multisite() )
4720  delete_transient( 'dirsize_cache' );
4721 
4722  /**
4723  * Fires before an attachment is deleted, at the start of wp_delete_attachment().
4724  *
4725  * @since 2.0.0
4726  *
4727  * @param int $post_id Attachment ID.
4728  */
4729  do_action( 'delete_attachment', $post_id );
4730 
4731  wp_delete_object_term_relationships($post_id, array('category', 'post_tag'));
4732  wp_delete_object_term_relationships($post_id, get_object_taxonomies($post->post_type));
4733 
4734  // Delete all for any posts.
4735  delete_metadata( 'post', null, '_thumbnail_id', $post_id, true );
4736 
4737  wp_defer_comment_counting( true );
4738 
4739  $comment_ids = $wpdb->get_col( $wpdb->prepare( "SELECT comment_ID FROM $wpdb->comments WHERE comment_post_ID = %d", $post_id ));
4740  foreach ( $comment_ids as $comment_id ) {
4741  wp_delete_comment( $comment_id, true );
4742  }
4743 
4744  wp_defer_comment_counting( false );
4745 
4746  $post_meta_ids = $wpdb->get_col( $wpdb->prepare( "SELECT meta_id FROM $wpdb->postmeta WHERE post_id = %d ", $post_id ));
4747  foreach ( $post_meta_ids as $mid )
4748  delete_metadata_by_mid( 'post', $mid );
4749 
4750  /** This action is documented in wp-includes/post.php */
4751  do_action( 'delete_post', $post_id );
4752  $result = $wpdb->delete( $wpdb->posts, array( 'ID' => $post_id ) );
4753  if ( ! $result ) {
4754  return false;
4755  }
4756  /** This action is documented in wp-includes/post.php */
4757  do_action( 'deleted_post', $post_id );
4758 
4759  $uploadpath = wp_upload_dir();
4760 
4761  if ( ! empty($meta['thumb']) ) {
4762  // Don't delete the thumb if another attachment uses it.
4763  if (! $wpdb->get_row( $wpdb->prepare( "SELECT meta_id FROM $wpdb->postmeta WHERE meta_key = '_wp_attachment_metadata' AND meta_value LIKE %s AND post_id <> %d", '%' . $wpdb->esc_like( $meta['thumb'] ) . '%', $post_id)) ) {
4764  $thumbfile = str_replace(basename($file), $meta['thumb'], $file);
4765  /** This filter is documented in wp-includes/functions.php */
4766  $thumbfile = apply_filters( 'wp_delete_file', $thumbfile );
4767  @ unlink( path_join($uploadpath['basedir'], $thumbfile) );
4768  }
4769  }
4770 
4771  // Remove intermediate and backup images if there are any.
4772  if ( isset( $meta['sizes'] ) && is_array( $meta['sizes'] ) ) {
4773  foreach ( $meta['sizes'] as $size => $sizeinfo ) {
4774  $intermediate_file = str_replace( basename( $file ), $sizeinfo['file'], $file );
4775  /** This filter is documented in wp-includes/functions.php */
4776  $intermediate_file = apply_filters( 'wp_delete_file', $intermediate_file );
4777  @ unlink( path_join( $uploadpath['basedir'], $intermediate_file ) );
4778  }
4779  }
4780 
4781  if ( is_array($backup_sizes) ) {
4782  foreach ( $backup_sizes as $size ) {
4783  $del_file = path_join( dirname($meta['file']), $size['file'] );
4784  /** This filter is documented in wp-includes/functions.php */
4785  $del_file = apply_filters( 'wp_delete_file', $del_file );
4786  @ unlink( path_join($uploadpath['basedir'], $del_file) );
4787  }
4788  }
4789 
4790  wp_delete_file( $file );
4791 
4792  clean_post_cache( $post );
4793 
4794  return $post;
4795 }

4856 /**
4857  * Retrieve the URL for an attachment.
4858  *
4859  * @since 2.1.0
4860  *
4861  * @global string $pagenow
4862  *
4863  * @param int $post_id Optional. Attachment ID. Default 0.
4864  * @return string|false Attachment URL, otherwise false.
4865  */
4866 function wp_get_attachment_url( $post_id = 0 ) {
4867  $post_id = (int) $post_id;
4868  if ( !$post = get_post( $post_id ) )
4869  return false;
4870 
4871  if ( 'attachment' != $post->post_type )
4872  return false;
4873 
4874  $url = '';
4875  // Get attached file.
4876  if ( $file = get_post_meta( $post->ID, '_wp_attached_file', true) ) {
4877  // Get upload directory.
4878  if ( ($uploads = wp_upload_dir()) && false === $uploads['error'] ) {
4879  // Check that the upload base exists in the file location.
4880  if ( 0 === strpos( $file, $uploads['basedir'] ) ) {
4881  // Replace file location with url location.
4882  $url = str_replace($uploads['basedir'], $uploads['baseurl'], $file);
4883  } elseif ( false !== strpos($file, 'wp-content/uploads') ) {
4884  // Get the directory name relative to the basedir (back compat for pre-2.7 uploads)
4885  $url = trailingslashit( $uploads['baseurl'] . '/' . _wp_get_attachment_relative_path( $file ) ) . basename( $file );
4886  } else {
4887  // It's a newly-uploaded file, therefore $file is relative to the basedir.
4888  $url = $uploads['baseurl'] . "/$file";
4889  }
4890  }
4891  }
4892 
4893  /*
4894  * If any of the above options failed, Fallback on the GUID as used pre-2.7,
4895  * not recommended to rely upon this.
4896  */
4897  if ( empty($url) ) {
4898  $url = get_the_guid( $post->ID );
4899  }
4900 
4901  // On SSL front-end, URLs should be HTTPS.
4902  if ( is_ssl() && ! is_admin() && 'wp-login.php' !== $GLOBALS['pagenow'] ) {
4903  $url = set_url_scheme( $url );
4904  }
4905 
4906  /**
4907  * Filter the attachment URL.
4908  *
4909  * @since 2.1.0
4910  *
4911  * @param string $url URL for the given attachment.
4912  * @param int $post_id Attachment ID.
4913  */
4914  $url = apply_filters( 'wp_get_attachment_url', $url, $post->ID );
4915 
4916  if ( empty( $url ) )
4917  return false;
4918 
4919  return $url;
4920 }

4988 /**
4989  * Verifies an attachment is of a given type.
4990  *
4991  * @since 4.2.0
4992  *
4993  * @param string $type Attachment type. Accepts 'image', 'audio', or 'video'.
4994  * @param int|WP_Post $post_id Optional. Attachment ID. Default 0.
4995  * @return bool True if one of the accepted types, false otherwise.
4996  */
4997 function wp_attachment_is( $type, $post_id = 0 ) {
4998  if ( ! $post = get_post( $post_id ) ) {
4999  return false;
5000  }
5001 
5002  if ( ! $file = get_attached_file( $post->ID ) ) {
5003  return false;
5004  }
5005 
5006  if ( 0 === strpos( $post->post_mime_type, $type . '/' ) ) {
5007  return true;
5008  }
5009 
5010  $check = wp_check_filetype( $file );
5011  if ( empty( $check['ext'] ) ) {
5012  return false;
5013  }
5014 
5015  $ext = $check['ext'];
5016 
5017  if ( 'import' !== $post->post_mime_type ) {
5018  return $type === $ext;
5019  }
5020 
5021  switch ( $type ) {
5022  case 'image':
5023  $image_exts = array( 'jpg', 'jpeg', 'jpe', 'gif', 'png' );
5024  return in_array( $ext, $image_exts );
5025 
5026  case 'audio':
5027  return in_array( $ext, wp_get_audio_extensions() );
5028 
5029  case 'video':
5030  return in_array( $ext, wp_get_video_extensions() );
5031 
5032  default:
5033  return $type === $ext;
5034  }
5035 }

5038  * Checks if the attachment is an image.

5042  * allowed WP_Post object to be passed.
5043  *
5044  * @param int|WP_Post $post Optional. Attachment ID. Default 0.
5045  * @return bool Whether the attachment is an image.
5046  */
5047 function wp_attachment_is_image( $post = 0 ) {
5048  return wp_attachment_is( 'image', $post );

5051 /**
5052  * Retrieve the icon for a MIME type.
5053  *
5054  * @since 2.1.0
5055  *
5056  * @param string|int $mime MIME type or attachment ID.
5057  * @return string|false Icon, false otherwise.
5058  */
5059 function wp_mime_type_icon( $mime = 0 ) {
5060  if ( !is_numeric($mime) )
5061  $icon = wp_cache_get("mime_type_icon_$mime");
5062 
5063  $post_id = 0;
5064  if ( empty($icon) ) {
5065  $post_mimes = array();
5066  if ( is_numeric($mime) ) {
5067  $mime = (int) $mime;
5068  if ( $post = get_post( $mime ) ) {
5069  $post_id = (int) $post->ID;
5070  $file = get_attached_file( $post_id );
5071  $ext = preg_replace('/^.+?\.([^.]+)$/', '$1', $file);
5072  if ( !empty($ext) ) {
5073  $post_mimes[] = $ext;
5074  if ( $ext_type = wp_ext2type( $ext ) )
5075  $post_mimes[] = $ext_type;
5076  }
5077  $mime = $post->post_mime_type;
5078  } else {
5079  $mime = 0;
5080  }
5081  } else {
5082  $post_mimes[] = $mime;
5083  }
5084 
5085  $icon_files = wp_cache_get('icon_files');
5086 
5087  if ( !is_array($icon_files) ) {
5088  /**
5089  * Filter the icon directory path.
5090  *
5091  * @since 2.0.0
5092  *
5093  * @param string $path Icon directory absolute path.
5094  */
5095  $icon_dir = apply_filters( 'icon_dir', ABSPATH . WPINC . '/images/media' );
5096 
5097  /**
5098  * Filter the icon directory URI.
5099  *
5100  * @since 2.0.0
5101  *
5102  * @param string $uri Icon directory URI.
5103  */
5104  $icon_dir_uri = apply_filters( 'icon_dir_uri', includes_url( 'images/media' ) );
5105 
5106  /**
5107  * Filter the list of icon directory URIs.
5108  *
5109  * @since 2.5.0
5110  *
5111  * @param array $uris List of icon directory URIs.
5112  */
5113  $dirs = apply_filters( 'icon_dirs', array( $icon_dir => $icon_dir_uri ) );
5114  $icon_files = array();
5115  while ( $dirs ) {
5116  $keys = array_keys( $dirs );
5117  $dir = array_shift( $keys );
5118  $uri = array_shift($dirs);
5119  if ( $dh = opendir($dir) ) {
5120  while ( false !== $file = readdir($dh) ) {
5121  $file = basename($file);
5122  if ( substr($file, 0, 1) == '.' )
5123  continue;
5124  if ( !in_array(strtolower(substr($file, -4)), array('.png', '.gif', '.jpg') ) ) {
5125  if ( is_dir("$dir/$file") )
5126  $dirs["$dir/$file"] = "$uri/$file";
5127  continue;
5128  }
5129  $icon_files["$dir/$file"] = "$uri/$file";
5130  }
5131  closedir($dh);
5132  }
5133  }
5134  wp_cache_add( 'icon_files', $icon_files, 'default', 600 );
5135  }
5136 
5137  $types = array();
5138  // Icon basename - extension = MIME wildcard.
5139  foreach ( $icon_files as $file => $uri )
5140  $types[ preg_replace('/^([^.]*).*$/', '$1', basename($file)) ] =& $icon_files[$file];
5141 
5142  if ( ! empty($mime) ) {
5143  $post_mimes[] = substr($mime, 0, strpos($mime, '/'));
5144  $post_mimes[] = substr($mime, strpos($mime, '/') + 1);
5145  $post_mimes[] = str_replace('/', '_', $mime);
5146  }
5147 
5148  $matches = wp_match_mime_types(array_keys($types), $post_mimes);
5149  $matches['default'] = array('default');
5150 
5151  foreach ( $matches as $match => $wilds ) {
5152  foreach ( $wilds as $wild ) {
5153  if ( ! isset( $types[ $wild ] ) ) {
5154  continue;
5155  }
5156 
5157  $icon = $types[ $wild ];
5158  if ( ! is_numeric( $mime ) ) {
5159  wp_cache_add( "mime_type_icon_$mime", $icon );
5160  }
5161  break 2;
5162  }
5163  }
5164  }
5165 
5166  /**
5167  * Filter the mime type icon.
5168  *
5169  * @since 2.1.0
5170  *
5171  * @param string $icon Path to the mime type icon.
5172  * @param string $mime Mime type.
5173  * @param int $post_id Attachment ID. Will equal 0 if the function passed
5174  * the mime type.
5175  */
5176  return apply_filters( 'wp_mime_type_icon', $icon, $mime, $post_id );
5177 }
5178 
5179 /**
5180  * Check for changed slugs for published post objects and save the old slug.
5181  *
5182  * The function is used when a post object of any type is updated,
5183  * by comparing the current and previous post objects.
5184  *
5185  * If the slug was changed and not already part of the old slugs then it will be
5186  * added to the post meta field ('_wp_old_slug') for storing old slugs for that
5187  * post.
5188  *
5189  * The most logically usage of this function is redirecting changed post objects, so
5190  * that those that linked to an changed post will be redirected to the new post.
5191  *
5192  * @since 2.1.0
5193  *
5194  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
5195  * @param WP_Post $post The Post Object
5196  * @param WP_Post $post_before The Previous Post Object
5197  */
5198 function wp_check_for_changed_slugs( $post_id, $post, $post_before ) {
5199  // Don't bother if it hasn't changed.
5200  if ( $post->post_name == $post_before->post_name ) {
5201  return;
5202  }
5203 
5204  // We're only concerned with published, non-hierarchical objects.
5205  if ( ! ( 'publish' === $post->post_status || ( 'attachment' === get_post_type( $post ) && 'inherit' === $post->post_status ) ) || is_post_type_hierarchical( $post->post_type ) ) {
5206  return;
5207  }
5208 
5209  $old_slugs = (array) get_post_meta( $post_id, '_wp_old_slug' );
5210 
5211  // If we haven't added this old slug before, add it now.
5212  if ( ! empty( $post_before->post_name ) && ! in_array( $post_before->post_name, $old_slugs ) ) {
5213  add_post_meta( $post_id, '_wp_old_slug', $post_before->post_name );
5214  }
5215 
5216  // If the new slug was used previously, delete it from the list.
5217  if ( in_array( $post->post_name, $old_slugs ) ) {
5218  delete_post_meta( $post_id, '_wp_old_slug', $post->post_name );
5219  }
5220 }
5221 
5222 /**
5223  * Retrieve the private post SQL based on capability.
5224  *
5225  * This function provides a standardized way to appropriately select on the
5226  * post_status of a post type. The function will return a piece of SQL code
5227  * that can be added to a WHERE clause; this SQL is constructed to allow all
5228  * published posts, and all private posts to which the user has access.
5229  *
5230  * @since 2.2.0
5231  * @since 4.3.0 Added the ability to pass an array to `$post_type`.
5232  *
5233  * @param string|array $post_type Single post type or an array of post types. Currently only supports 'post' or 'page'.
5234  * @return string SQL code that can be added to a where clause.
5235  */
5236 function get_private_posts_cap_sql( $post_type ) {
5237  return get_posts_by_author_sql( $post_type, false );
5238 }
5239 
5240 /**
5241  * Retrieve the post SQL based on capability, author, and type.
5242  *
5243  * @since 3.0.0
5244  * @since 4.3.0 Introduced the ability to pass an array of post types to `$post_type`.
5245  *
5246  * @see get_private_posts_cap_sql()
5247  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
5248  *
5249  * @param array|string $post_type Single post type or an array of post types.
5250  * @param bool $full Optional. Returns a full WHERE statement instead of just
5251  * an 'andalso' term. Default true.
5252  * @param int $post_author Optional. Query posts having a single author ID. Default null.
5253  * @param bool $public_only Optional. Only return public posts. Skips cap checks for
5254  * $current_user. Default false.
5255  * @return string SQL WHERE code that can be added to a query.
5256  */
5257 function get_posts_by_author_sql( $post_type, $full = true, $post_author = null, $public_only = false ) {
5258  global $wpdb;
5259 
5260  if ( is_array( $post_type ) ) {
5261  $post_types = $post_type;
5262  } else {
5263  $post_types = array( $post_type );
5264  }
5265 
5266  $post_type_clauses = array();
5267  foreach ( $post_types as $post_type ) {
5268  $post_type_obj = get_post_type_object( $post_type );
5269  if ( ! $post_type_obj ) {
5270  continue;
5271  }
5272 
5273  /**
5274  * Filter the capability to read private posts for a custom post type
5275  * when generating SQL for getting posts by author.
5276  *
5277  * @since 2.2.0
5278  * @deprecated 3.2.0 The hook transitioned from "somewhat useless" to "totally useless".
5279  *
5280  * @param string $cap Capability.
5281  */
5282  if ( ! $cap = apply_filters( 'pub_priv_sql_capability', '' ) ) {
5283  $cap = current_user_can( $post_type_obj->cap->read_private_posts );
5284  }
5285 
5286  // Only need to check the cap if $public_only is false.
5287  $post_status_sql = "post_status = 'publish'";
5288  if ( false === $public_only ) {
5289  if ( $cap ) {
5290  // Does the user have the capability to view private posts? Guess so.
5291  $post_status_sql .= " OR post_status = 'private'";
5292  } elseif ( is_user_logged_in() ) {
5293  // Users can view their own private posts.
5294  $id = get_current_user_id();
5295  if ( null === $post_author || ! $full ) {
5296  $post_status_sql .= " OR post_status = 'private' AND post_author = $id";
5297  } elseif ( $id == (int) $post_author ) {
5298  $post_status_sql .= " OR post_status = 'private'";
5299  } // else none
5300  } // else none
5301  }
5302 
5303  $post_type_clauses[] = "( post_type = '" . $post_type . "' AND ( $post_status_sql ) )";
5304  }
5305 
5306  if ( empty( $post_type_clauses ) ) {
5307  return $full ? 'WHERE 1 = 0' : '1 = 0';
5308  }
5309 
5310  $sql = '( '. implode( ' OR ', $post_type_clauses ) . ' )';
5311 
5312  if ( null !== $post_author ) {
5313  $sql .= $wpdb->prepare( ' AND post_author = %d', $post_author );
5314  }
5315 
5316  if ( $full ) {
5317  $sql = 'WHERE ' . $sql;
5318  }
5319 
5320  return $sql;
5321 }
