5323 /**
5324  * Retrieve the date that the last post was published.
5325  *
5326  * The server timezone is the default and is the difference between GMT and
5327  * server time. The 'blog' value is the date when the last post was posted. The
5328  * 'gmt' is when the last post was posted in GMT formatted date.
5329  *
5330  * @since 0.71
5331  * @since 4.4.0 The `$post_type` argument was added.
5332  *
5333  * @param string $timezone Optional. The timezone for the timestamp. Accepts 'server', 'blog', or 'gmt'.
5334  * 'server' uses the server's internal timezone.
5335  * 'blog' uses the `post_modified` field, which proxies to the timezone set for the site.
5336  * 'gmt' uses the `post_modified_gmt` field.
5337  * Default 'server'.
5338  * @param string $post_type Optional. The post type to check. Default 'any'.
5339  * @return string The date of the last post.
5340  */
5341 function get_lastpostdate( $timezone = 'server', $post_type = 'any' ) {
5342  /**
5343  * Filter the date the last post was published.
5344  *
5345  * @since 2.3.0
5346  *
5347  * @param string $date Date the last post was published.
5348  * @param string $timezone Location to use for getting the post published date.
5349  * See {@see get_lastpostdate()} for accepted `$timezone` values.
5350  */
5351  return apply_filters( 'get_lastpostdate', _get_last_post_time( $timezone, 'date', $post_type ), $timezone );
5352 }
5353 
5354 /**
5355  * Get the timestamp of the last time any post was modified.
5356  *
5357  * The server timezone is the default and is the difference between GMT and
5358  * server time. The 'blog' value is just when the last post was modified. The
5359  * 'gmt' is when the last post was modified in GMT time.
5360  *
5361  * @since 1.2.0
5362  * @since 4.4.0 The `$post_type` argument was added.
5363  *
5364  * @param string $timezone Optional. The timezone for the timestamp. See {@see get_lastpostdate()}
5365  * for information on accepted values.
5366  * Default 'server'.
5367  * @param string $post_type Optional. The post type to check. Default 'any'.
5368  * @return string The timestamp.
5369  */
5370 function get_lastpostmodified( $timezone = 'server', $post_type = 'any' ) {
5371  /**
5372  * Pre-filter the return value of get_lastpostmodified() before the query is run.
5373  *
5374  * @since 4.4.0
5375  *
5376  * @param string $lastpostmodified Date the last post was modified.
5377  * Returning anything other than false will short-circuit the function.
5378  * @param string $timezone Location to use for getting the post modified date.
5379  * See {@see get_lastpostdate()} for accepted `$timezone` values.
5380  * @param string $post_type The post type to check.
5381  */
5382  $lastpostmodified = apply_filters( 'pre_get_lastpostmodified', false, $timezone, $post_type );
5383  if ( false !== $lastpostmodified ) {
5384  return $lastpostmodified;
5385  }
5386 
5387  $lastpostmodified = _get_last_post_time( $timezone, 'modified', $post_type );
5388 
5389  $lastpostdate = get_lastpostdate($timezone);
5390  if ( $lastpostdate > $lastpostmodified ) {
5391  $lastpostmodified = $lastpostdate;
5392  }
5393 
5394  /**
5395  * Filter the date the last post was modified.
5396  *
5397  * @since 2.3.0
5398  *
5399  * @param string $lastpostmodified Date the last post was modified.
5400  * @param string $timezone Location to use for getting the post modified date.
5401  * See {@see get_lastpostdate()} for accepted `$timezone` values.
5402  */
5403  return apply_filters( 'get_lastpostmodified', $lastpostmodified, $timezone );
5404 }
5405 
5406 /**
5407  * Get the timestamp of the last time any post was modified or published.
5408  *
5409  * @since 3.1.0
5410  * @since 4.4.0 The `$post_type` argument was added.
5411  * @access private
5412  *
5413  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
5414  *
5415  * @param string $timezone The timezone for the timestamp. See get_lastpostdate().
5416  * for information on accepted values.
5417  * @param string $field Post field to check. Accepts 'date' or 'modified'.
5418  * @param string $post_type Optional. The post type to check. Default 'any'.
5419  * @return string|false The timestamp.
5420  */
5421 function _get_last_post_time( $timezone, $field, $post_type = 'any' ) {
5422  global $wpdb;
5423 
5424  if ( ! in_array( $field, array( 'date', 'modified' ) ) ) {
5425  return false;
5426  }
5427 
5428  $timezone = strtolower( $timezone );
5429 
5430  $key = "lastpost{$field}:$timezone";
5431  if ( 'any' !== $post_type ) {
5432  $key .= ':' . sanitize_key( $post_type );
5433  }
5434 
5435  $date = wp_cache_get( $key, 'timeinfo' );
5436 
5437  if ( ! $date ) {
5438  if ( 'any' === $post_type ) {
5439  $post_types = get_post_types( array( 'public' => true ) );
5440  array_walk( $post_types, array( $wpdb, 'escape_by_ref' ) );
5441  $post_types = "'" . implode( "', '", $post_types ) . "'";
5442  } else {
5443  $post_types = "'" . sanitize_key( $post_type ) . "'";
5444  }
5445 
5446  switch ( $timezone ) {
5447  case 'gmt':
5448  $date = $wpdb->get_var("SELECT post_{$field}_gmt FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_status = 'publish' AND post_type IN ({$post_types}) ORDER BY post_{$field}_gmt DESC LIMIT 1");
5449  break;
5450  case 'blog':
5451  $date = $wpdb->get_var("SELECT post_{$field} FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_status = 'publish' AND post_type IN ({$post_types}) ORDER BY post_{$field}_gmt DESC LIMIT 1");
5452  break;
5453  case 'server':
5454  $add_seconds_server = date( 'Z' );
5455  $date = $wpdb->get_var("SELECT DATE_ADD(post_{$field}_gmt, INTERVAL '$add_seconds_server' SECOND) FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_status = 'publish' AND post_type IN ({$post_types}) ORDER BY post_{$field}_gmt DESC LIMIT 1");
5456  break;
5457  }
5458 
5459  if ( $date ) {
5460  wp_cache_set( $key, $date, 'timeinfo' );
5461  }
5462  }
5463 
5464  return $date;
5465 }

5471  *

5473  */

5476  return;
5477 
5478  foreach ( $posts as $post )
5479  wp_cache_add( $post->ID, $post, 'posts' );
5480 }

5482 /**
5483  * Will clean the post in the cache.
5484  *
5485  * Cleaning means delete from the cache of the post. Will call to clean the term
5486  * object cache associated with the post ID.
5487  *
5488  * This function not run if $_wp_suspend_cache_invalidation is not empty. See
5489  * wp_suspend_cache_invalidation().
5490  *
5491  * @since 2.0.0
5492  *
5493  * @global bool $_wp_suspend_cache_invalidation
5494  *
5495  * @param int|WP_Post $post Post ID or post object to remove from the cache.
5496  */
5497 function clean_post_cache( $post ) {
5498  global $_wp_suspend_cache_invalidation;
5499 
5500  if ( ! empty( $_wp_suspend_cache_invalidation ) )
5501  return;
5502 
5503  $post = get_post( $post );
5504  if ( empty( $post ) )
5505  return;
5506 
5507  wp_cache_delete( $post->ID, 'posts' );
5508  wp_cache_delete( $post->ID, 'post_meta' );
5509 
5510  clean_object_term_cache( $post->ID, $post->post_type );
5511 
5512  wp_cache_delete( 'wp_get_archives', 'general' );
5513

5520  * @param WP_Post $post Post object.
5521  */
5522  do_action( 'clean_post_cache', $post->ID, $post );
5523 
5524  if ( 'page' == $post->post_type ) {
5525  wp_cache_delete( 'all_page_ids', 'posts' );
5526 
5527  /**
5528  * Fires immediately after the given page's cache is cleaned.
5529  *
5530  * @since 2.5.0
5531  *
5532  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
5533  */
5534  do_action( 'clean_page_cache', $post->ID );
5535  }
5536 
5537  wp_cache_set( 'last_changed', microtime(), 'posts' );
5538 }

5540 /**
5541  * Call major cache updating functions for list of Post objects.
5542  *
5543  * @since 1.5.0
5544  *
5545  * @param array $posts Array of Post objects
5546  * @param string $post_type Optional. Post type. Default 'post'.
5547  * @param bool $update_term_cache Optional. Whether to update the term cache. Default true.
5548  * @param bool $update_meta_cache Optional. Whether to update the meta cache. Default true.
5549  */
5550 function update_post_caches( &$posts, $post_type = 'post', $update_term_cache = true, $update_meta_cache = true ) {
5551  // No point in doing all this work if we didn't match any posts.
5552  if ( !$posts )
5553  return;
5554 
5555  update_post_cache($posts);
5556 
5557  $post_ids = array();
5558  foreach ( $posts as $post )
5559  $post_ids[] = $post->ID;
5560 
5561  if ( ! $post_type )
5562  $post_type = 'any';
5563 
5564  if ( $update_term_cache ) {
5565  if ( is_array($post_type) ) {
5566  $ptypes = $post_type;
5567  } elseif ( 'any' == $post_type ) {
5568  $ptypes = array();
5569  // Just use the post_types in the supplied posts.
5570  foreach ( $posts as $post ) {
5571  $ptypes[] = $post->post_type;
5572  }
5573  $ptypes = array_unique($ptypes);
5574  } else {
5575  $ptypes = array($post_type);
5576  }
5577 
5578  if ( ! empty($ptypes) )
5579  update_object_term_cache($post_ids, $ptypes);
5580  }
5581 
5582  if ( $update_meta_cache )
5583  update_postmeta_cache($post_ids);
5584 }

5646 /**
5647  * Hook for managing future post transitions to published.
5648  *
5649  * @since 2.3.0
5650  * @access private
5651  *
5652  * @see wp_clear_scheduled_hook()
5653  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
5654  *
5655  * @param string $new_status New post status.
5656  * @param string $old_status Previous post status.
5657  * @param WP_Post $post Post object.
5658  */
5659 function _transition_post_status( $new_status, $old_status, $post ) {
5660  global $wpdb;
5661 
5662  if ( $old_status != 'publish' && $new_status == 'publish' ) {
5663  // Reset GUID if transitioning to publish and it is empty.
5664  if ( '' == get_the_guid($post->ID) )
5665  $wpdb->update( $wpdb->posts, array( 'guid' => get_permalink( $post->ID ) ), array( 'ID' => $post->ID ) );
5666 
5667  /**
5668  * Fires when a post's status is transitioned from private to published.
5669  *
5670  * @since 1.5.0
5671  * @deprecated 2.3.0 Use 'private_to_publish' instead.
5672  *
5673  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
5674  */
5675  do_action('private_to_published', $post->ID);
5676  }
5677 
5678  // If published posts changed clear the lastpostmodified cache.
5679  if ( 'publish' == $new_status || 'publish' == $old_status) {
5680  foreach ( array( 'server', 'gmt', 'blog' ) as $timezone ) {
5681  wp_cache_delete( "lastpostmodified:$timezone", 'timeinfo' );
5682  wp_cache_delete( "lastpostdate:$timezone", 'timeinfo' );
5683  wp_cache_delete( "lastpostdate:$timezone:{$post->post_type}", 'timeinfo' );
5684  }
5685  }
5686 
5687  if ( $new_status !== $old_status ) {
5688  wp_cache_delete( _count_posts_cache_key( $post->post_type ), 'counts' );
5689  wp_cache_delete( _count_posts_cache_key( $post->post_type, 'readable' ), 'counts' );
5690  }
5691 
5692  // Always clears the hook in case the post status bounced from future to draft.
5693  wp_clear_scheduled_hook('publish_future_post', array( $post->ID ) );
5694 }
5695 
5696 /**
5697  * Hook used to schedule publication for a post marked for the future.
5698  *
5699  * The $post properties used and must exist are 'ID' and 'post_date_gmt'.
5700  *
5701  * @since 2.3.0
5702  * @access private
5703  *
5704  * @param int $deprecated Not used. Can be set to null. Never implemented. Not marked
5705  * as deprecated with _deprecated_argument() as it conflicts with
5706  * wp_transition_post_status() and the default filter for
5707  * {@see _future_post_hook()}.
5708  * @param WP_Post $post Post object.
5709  */
5710 function _future_post_hook( $deprecated, $post ) {
5711  wp_clear_scheduled_hook( 'publish_future_post', array( $post->ID ) );
5712  wp_schedule_single_event( strtotime( get_gmt_from_date( $post->post_date ) . ' GMT') , 'publish_future_post', array( $post->ID ) );
5713 }
5714 
5715 /**
5716  * Hook to schedule pings and enclosures when a post is published.
5717  *
5718  * Uses XMLRPC_REQUEST and WP_IMPORTING constants.
5719  *
5720  * @since 2.3.0
5721  * @access private
5722  *
5723  * @param int $post_id The ID in the database table of the post being published.
5724  */
5725 function _publish_post_hook( $post_id ) {
5726  if ( defined( 'XMLRPC_REQUEST' ) ) {
5727  /**
5728  * Fires when _publish_post_hook() is called during an XML-RPC request.
5729  *
5730  * @since 2.1.0
5731  *
5732  * @param int $post_id Post ID.
5733  */
5734  do_action( 'xmlrpc_publish_post', $post_id );
5735  }
5736 
5737  if ( defined('WP_IMPORTING') )
5738  return;
5739 
5740  if ( get_option('default_pingback_flag') )
5741  add_post_meta( $post_id, '_pingme', '1' );
5742  add_post_meta( $post_id, '_encloseme', '1' );
5743 
5744  wp_schedule_single_event(time(), 'do_pings');
5745 }

5747 /**
5748  * Return the post's parent's post_ID
5749  *
5750  * @since 3.1.0
5751  *
5752  * @param int $post_ID
5753  *
5754  * @return int|false Post parent ID, otherwise false.
5755  */
5756 function wp_get_post_parent_id( $post_ID ) {
5757  $post = get_post( $post_ID );
5758  if ( !$post || is_wp_error( $post ) )
5759  return false;
5760  return (int) $post->post_parent;
5761 }
5762 
5763 /**
5764  * Check the given subset of the post hierarchy for hierarchy loops.
5765  *
5766  * Prevents loops from forming and breaks those that it finds. Attached
5767  * to the 'wp_insert_post_parent' filter.
5768  *
5769  * @since 3.1.0
5770  *
5771  * @see wp_find_hierarchy_loop()
5772  *
5773  * @param int $post_parent ID of the parent for the post we're checking.
5774  * @param int $post_ID ID of the post we're checking.
5775  * @return int The new post_parent for the post, 0 otherwise.
5776  */
5777 function wp_check_post_hierarchy_for_loops( $post_parent, $post_ID ) {
5778  // Nothing fancy here - bail.
5779  if ( !$post_parent )
5780  return 0;
5781 
5782  // New post can't cause a loop.
5783  if ( empty( $post_ID ) )
5784  return $post_parent;
5785 
5786  // Can't be its own parent.
5787  if ( $post_parent == $post_ID )
5788  return 0;
5789 
5790  // Now look for larger loops.
5791  if ( !$loop = wp_find_hierarchy_loop( 'wp_get_post_parent_id', $post_ID, $post_parent ) )
5792  return $post_parent; // No loop
5793 
5794  // Setting $post_parent to the given value causes a loop.
5795  if ( isset( $loop[$post_ID] ) )
5796  return 0;
5797 
5798  // There's a loop, but it doesn't contain $post_ID. Break the loop.
5799  foreach ( array_keys( $loop ) as $loop_member )
5800  wp_update_post( array( 'ID' => $loop_member, 'post_parent' => 0 ) );
5801 
5802  return $post_parent;
5803 }

5805 /**
5806  * Set a post thumbnail.
5807  *
5808  * @since 3.1.0
5809  *
5810  * @param int|WP_Post $post Post ID or post object where thumbnail should be attached.
5811  * @param int $thumbnail_id Thumbnail to attach.
5812  * @return int|bool True on success, false on failure.
5813  */
5814 function set_post_thumbnail( $post, $thumbnail_id ) {
5815  $post = get_post( $post );
5816  $thumbnail_id = absint( $thumbnail_id );
5817  if ( $post && $thumbnail_id && get_post( $thumbnail_id ) ) {
5818  if ( wp_get_attachment_image( $thumbnail_id, 'thumbnail' ) )
5819  return update_post_meta( $post->ID, '_thumbnail_id', $thumbnail_id );
5820  else
5821  return delete_post_meta( $post->ID, '_thumbnail_id' );
5822  }
5823  return false;
5824 }

5832  * @return bool True on success, false on failure.
5833  */
5834 function delete_post_thumbnail( $post ) {
5835  $post = get_post( $post );
5836  if ( $post )
5837  return delete_post_meta( $post->ID, '_thumbnail_id' );
5838  return false;
5839 }

5841 /**
5842  * Delete auto-drafts for new posts that are > 7 days old.
5843  *
5844  * @since 3.4.0
5845  *
5846  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
5847  */
5848 function wp_delete_auto_drafts() {
5849  global $wpdb;
5850 
5851  // Cleanup old auto-drafts more than 7 days old.
5852  $old_posts = $wpdb->get_col( "SELECT ID FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_status = 'auto-draft' AND DATE_SUB( NOW(), INTERVAL 7 DAY ) > post_date" );
5853  foreach ( (array) $old_posts as $delete ) {
5854  // Force delete.
5855  wp_delete_post( $delete, true );
5856  }
5857 }

5859 /**
5860  * Update the custom taxonomies' term counts when a post's status is changed.
5861  *
5862  * For example, default posts term counts (for custom taxonomies) don't include
5863  * private / draft posts.
5864  *
5865  * @since 3.3.0
5866  * @access private
5867  *
5868  * @param string $new_status New post status.
5869  * @param string $old_status Old post status.
5870  * @param WP_Post $post Post object.
5871  */
5872 function _update_term_count_on_transition_post_status( $new_status, $old_status, $post ) {
5873  // Update counts for the post's terms.
5874  foreach ( (array) get_object_taxonomies( $post->post_type ) as $taxonomy ) {
5875  $tt_ids = wp_get_object_terms( $post->ID, $taxonomy, array( 'fields' => 'tt_ids' ) );
5876  wp_update_term_count( $tt_ids, $taxonomy );
5877  }
5878 }
5879 
5880 /**
5881  * Adds any posts from the given ids to the cache that do not already exist in cache
5882  *
5883  * @since 3.4.0
5884  * @access private
5885  *
5886  * @see update_post_caches()
5887  *
5888  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
5889  *
5890  * @param array $ids ID list.
5891  * @param bool $update_term_cache Optional. Whether to update the term cache. Default true.
5892  * @param bool $update_meta_cache Optional. Whether to update the meta cache. Default true.
5893  */
5894 function _prime_post_caches( $ids, $update_term_cache = true, $update_meta_cache = true ) {
5895  global $wpdb;
5896 
5897  $non_cached_ids = _get_non_cached_ids( $ids, 'posts' );
5898  if ( !empty( $non_cached_ids ) ) {
5899  $fresh_posts = $wpdb->get_results( sprintf( "SELECT $wpdb->posts.* FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE ID IN (%s)", join( ",", $non_cached_ids ) ) );
5900 
5901  update_post_caches( $fresh_posts, 'any', $update_term_cache, $update_meta_cache );
5902  }
5903 }
